brief_summary.textblock:
The aim of the study is to find out prevalence of diabetic macular edema (DME) in patients
      with diabetes mellitus in Slovak Republic.The outcome of the project will be epidemiology
      survey, prevalence of wet form of Diabetic Macular Edema in relation to duration of
      diabetes, type of diabetes, treatment (insulin vs. OAD or combination) etc. and
      identification of prognostic factors leading to development of DME.

clinical_study.brief_title: Reading Center - Occurence of Diabetic Macular Edema in Patients With Diabetes Mellitus in Slovak Republic

detailed_description.textblock:
Epidemiological study, prospective, non-interventional

        1. Patient with history of diabetes ≥ 10 years or with suspected visual impairment will be
           enrolled and screened in NIED during hospitalization

        2. Anamnesis and history of diabetes, other co-morbidities, treatment will be recorded

        3. Patient undergo in NIED detailed diabetology examination and basic ophthalmology
           examination (best non-corrected visual acuity in ETDRS score and Amsler grid test)

        4. Patient undergo in NIED examination of the back of the eye using fundus camera to take
           images of retina to assess long-term changes of macula, optic disc, retina vessels and
           surrounding tissues

        5. The assessment of the ophthalmology examination will be carried out in one of two
           specialized reading centers - II. Eye Clinic SZU FNsP F.D.R., Banská Bystrica or OFTAL
           Specialized Hospital for Ophthalmology, Zvolen by Retina specialist

      The process of screening will be continuous, whilst each patient will sign an informed
      consent.

      Patients records will be stored electronically and data transmission between NIED and
      Reading Center will be protected using validated and secured software.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Adults  ≥18 years treated in National Institute of Endocrinology and Diabetology

          -  Patients diagnosed with Diabetes mellitus type I and type 2 respectively

          -  Presence of Diabetes ≥10 years or patients with suspected visual impairment (duration
             of diabetes <10 years)

          -  Signed patient´s information and informed content

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Non-compliant patients

study_pop.textblock:
Adults regularly examined in National Institute of Endocrinology and Diabetology (NIED)
        for their severity and complications of diabetes will undergo a screening procedure using
        fundus camera to assess the back of the eye (fundus examination).

clinical_study.keyword: DME, diabetic retinopathy, diabetes mellitus, epidemiology
clinical_study.official_title: Reading Center - Occurence of Diabetic Macular Edema in Patients With Diabetes Mellitus in Slovak Republic

overall_official.affiliation: II. Eye Clinic SZU of F.D.Roosevelt Hospital, Banska Bystrica
Oftal, s.r.o. Specialized Hospital for Ophthalmology, Zvolen
Department of Diabetology of National Institute for Endocrinology and Diabetology, Lubochna

oversight_info.authority: Slovakia: State Institute for Drug Control

primary_outcome.description: Image of fundus taken in NIED securely sent via internet and electronic Clinical Report Form (eCRF) to ophthalmology reading center to assess stage and severity of potential retina damage, feedback to NIED within the stay of screened individual essential for further disease management
primary_outcome.measure: Prevalence of Diabetic Macular Edema or clinically significant Diabetic Macular Edema
primary_outcome.time_frame: Patients screened during hospitalization in National Institute of Endocrinology and Diabetology  (NIED), usually in 10 days

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: National Institute of Endocrinology and Diabetology, Slovakia

secondary_outcome.measure: Patient´s structure with DME and clinically significant DME in terms of demography and anamnesis of diabetes
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Patients screened during hospitalization in NIED, usually in 10 days

secondary_outcome.measure: Range of visual deterioration and occurence of blindness in relation to duration of diabetes
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Patients screened during hospitalization in NIED, usually in 10 days

secondary_outcome.measure: Prognostic factors, which determine the occurence of DME using explorative analysis
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Patients screened during hospitalization in NIED, usually in 10 days

secondary_outcome.measure: Range of visual deterioration and occurence of blindness in relation to type of diabetes
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Patients screened during hospitalization in NIED, usually in 10 days

secondary_outcome.measure: Range of visual deterioration and occurence of blindness in relation to general treatment (insulin vs. OAD or combination therapy)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Patients screened during hospitalization in NIED, usually in 10 days
